## Summary of Article on DuPont de Nemours (DD)

**Note:** The article appears to be a composite financial summary/news roundup, likely from a financial data aggregator. Some sections may be slightly dated relative to the question's timeframe.

---

### Analyst Price Targets & Ratings
- **Wells Fargo** raised PT from $50 → **$55**, maintaining "overweight" rating (implied ~9% upside from then-current price)
- **KeyCorp** raised PT from $51 → **$57**, "overweight"
- **UBS Group** raised PT from $49 → **$56**, "buy"
- **Mizuho** raised PT from $46 → **$52**, "outperform"
- **BMO Capital Markets** *cut* PT from $104 → **$50**, "outperform"
- **Weiss Ratings** maintained "sell (D+)"
- **Wall Street Zen** upgraded to "hold"
- Overall consensus: **"Moderate Buy"** with average PT of **$49.46** (12 Buy, 4 Hold, 1 Sell)

---

### Recent Financial Performance
- **Q4 EPS:** $0.46 vs. $0.43 estimate (beat by $0.03)
- **Q4 Revenue:** $1.69 billion (in-line with estimates), up 0.2% YoY
- **Q1 2026 Guidance:** $0.48 EPS
- **FY 2026 Guidance:** $2.25–$2.30 EPS (above consensus)
- Analysts project **$4.38 EPS** for current fiscal year
- Negative net margin of 6.17%; positive ROE of 7.81%

---

### Stock Performance Metrics
- Opened at **$50.44** on the article's reference date
- 52-week low: **$22.50** / high: **$49.85**
- 50-day SMA: $42.67 | 200-day SMA: $36.89
- Market cap: **$21.13 billion**; Beta: 1.10
- Debt-to-equity: 0.30; Current ratio: 2.00

---

### Corporate Actions
- Board approved **$2 billion share buyback** (~12.2% of shares), signaling management believes shares are undervalued
- **Insider selling:** CEO Lori Koch sold 9,011 shares (~$355K) and SVP Erik Hoover sold 6,005 shares (~$239K), both in late November at ~$39–$40/share

---

### Institutional Ownership
- **73.96%** institutionally owned; several hedge funds increased positions in Q2–Q3

---

### Key Sentiment Signals
- **Positive:** Earnings beat, raised guidance, multiple analyst PT upgrades, Jim Cramer praise noted
- **Neutral:** Valuation debate after multi-year gains; mixed peer comparisons; some analysts describe growth as "unimpressive"
- **Negative:** Short interest rose ~23.6% in January to ~9.24M shares (~2.2% of float); Q4 sales essentially flat; building technologies segment hurt by weak construction; GAAP results showed a loss from continuing operations
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.marketbeat.com/instant-alerts/filing-primecap-management-co-ca-sells-177765-shares-of-dupont-de-nemours-inc-dd-2026-02-27/">

- **Mondrian Investment Partners LTD** acquired a new stake of 1,777,954 shares (~$138.5M) in Q3, making DD its 16th largest position at 2.3% of its portfolio (0.42% of DD's outstanding shares).

### Analyst Ratings & Price Targets

- **Jefferies Financial Group**: Raised price target from $51 to $59; "Buy" rating (Feb 11)
- **Wolfe Research**: Raised price target from $49 to $54; "Outperform" rating (Feb 11)
- **Zacks Research**: Upgraded from "Hold" to "Strong-Buy" (Feb 12)
- **Weiss Ratings**: Reiterated "Sell (D+)" rating (Dec 22)
- **Consensus**: "Moderate Buy" with an average target price of **$50.46**

### Financial Performance
- Q4 EPS: $0.46, beating consensus estimate of $0.43 by $0.03
- Quarterly revenue: $1.69B (in line with estimates), up 0.2% YoY
- Negative net margin of -7.03%; positive return on equity of 7.37%
- **FY2026 EPS guidance**: $2.25–$2.30; **Q1 2026 EPS guidance**: $0.48
- Analysts project full-year EPS of $4.38

### Stock Metrics (at time of article)
- Stock opened at **$50.19**
- 50-day SMA: $43.48 | 200-day SMA: $37.44
- 12-month range: $22.50–$52.66
- Market cap: ~$21.03B; Beta: 1.10; P/E: -26.98; PEG: 1.26

### Insider Activity
- **CEO Lori Koch** sold 9,011 shares at ~$39.46/share (~$355,574) on Nov 28, reducing her position by 3.03%
- **SVP Erik T. Hoover** sold 6,005 shares at ~$39.79/share (~$238,939) on Nov 28, reducing his position by 5.08%

### Share Buyback
- Board authorized a **$2B share buyback program** (Nov 6), representing up to 12.2% of outstanding shares
</Summary>

**Disclaimer:** This article contains no information relevant to DuPont de Nemours (DD) stock or its price movements. The content is entirely about 3-Month SONIA (Sterling Overnight Index Average) futures options from Barchart.com.

**Summary:**

The article is an educational/reference page from Barchart.com describing the **Volatility & Greeks View** for 3-Month SONIA March 2026 Futures Options. It explains the theoretical framework based on the **Black-Scholes Option Pricing Model** and defines the following key metrics displayed in the options table:

- **Implied Volatility** – Whether options are fairly valued relative to historical volatility
- **Delta** – Sensitivity of option value to a $1 change in the underlying asset
- **Gamma** – Rate of change in delta per one-point move in the underlying
- **Theta** – Daily dollar loss in option value due to time decay
- **Vega** – Sensitivity of option price to volatility changes
- **IV Skew** – Difference between out-of-the-money and at-the-money implied volatility

The page also notes display customization options for logged-in Barchart members (e.g., number of strikes shown, page layout).

**This article provides no useful information for forecasting DD's stock price.**
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/dd-march-2026-options-begin-trading">

<Summary source="https://www.barchart.com/futures/quotes/J8H26/volatility-greeks/jan-26%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D%5B%5B%20filters%20%5D%5D[[%20filters%20]]">
**Disclaimer:** This article contains no information relevant to DuPont de Nemours (DD) stock or its price movements. It is entirely unrelated to the forecasting question at hand.

**Summary:**

The article is a general explainer page from Barchart.com describing the **Volatility & Greeks View** for 3-Month SONIA March '26 Futures Options — a UK interest rate futures product, entirely unrelated to DD stock.

The page defines and explains the following options trading metrics displayed in Barchart's analytical table:

- **Implied Volatility (IV):** A measure of market expectations for future price volatility, derived mathematically from current option prices.
- **Delta:** Sensitivity of an option's value to a $1 change in the underlying asset's price (ranges from -1 to 1).
- **Gamma:** Rate of change in delta for each one-point move in the underlying; always positive, largest at-the-money.
- **Theta:** Measures time decay — the daily dollar loss in option value as expiration approaches.
- **Vega:** Sensitivity of option price to changes in volatility; affects calls and puts equally.
- **IV Skew:** The difference between an out-of-the-money option's implied volatility and the at-the-money option's implied volatility.

The page also describes customization options available to logged-in Barchart members (strike range selection, layout preferences, sort order).

**No information relevant to DD's stock price is contained in this article.**
</Summary>

Query: Coverage of DuPont de Nemours contracts, litigation, or management commentary February-March 2026, North America and Europe
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Groupe ADP Replaces Rothschild with Kepler Cheuvreux for Liquidity Contract in 2026**
On March 2, 2026, Aéroports de Paris SA (Groupe ADP) announced the termination of its liquidity contract with Rothschild & Cie Banque, which had been in effect since January 4, 2010, and the signing of a new liquidity agreement with Kepler Cheuvreux on February 27, 2026. The new contract aims to facilitate trading of ADP shares on the regulated market of Euronext Paris and will comply with EU Regulation (UE) n° 596/2014 on market abuse (MAR) and AMF Decision n° 2021-01. A sum of 18,560,140.30 euros has been allocated to the liquidity account. The document outlines the 2026 financial calendar: February traffic data to be published on March 16, 2026, Q1 revenue on April 28, 2026, semi-annual results on July 29, 2026, and nine-month revenue on October 22, 2026. The shareholders' general meeting is scheduled for May 21, 2026, with dividend detachment on June 2, 2026, and payment on June 4, 2026. In 2025, the group handled approximately 379 million passengers across 26 airports, including 107 million at the three Île-de-France platforms (Paris-Charles de Gaulle, Paris-Orly, and Paris-Le Bourget), generating 6,704 million euros in revenue and a net profit of 382 million euros. The company is led by over 6,000 employees in Paris and maintains strategic partnerships with TAV Airports in Turkey and the Middle East and GMR Airports in India and Southeast Asia.
Original language: fr
Publish date: March 02, 2026 08:52 AM
Source:[Les Echos](https://lesechos-comfi.lesechos.fr/press-release/groupe-adp-epa-adp-aeroports-de-paris-sa-cessation-du-contrat-de-liquidite-avec-rothschild-cie-et-mise-en-oeuvre-dun-nouveau-contrat-de-liquidite-avec-kepler-cheuvreux-kOJM3HbZ6GL)

**Nanoemulsions Market Is Going to Boom | Croda International * BASF SE * Evonik Industries AG**
Coherent Market Insights has released a report titled 'Nanoemulsions Market: Industry Trends, Share, Size, Growth, Opportunity, and Forecast 2026-2033', which analyzes the market's competition, geographic distribution, and growth potential. The report covers industry performance, critical success factors, risk assessment, manufacturing prerequisites, project expenses, economic analysis, anticipated return on investment (ROI), and profit margins. According to the report, major market players include Croda International, BASF SE, Evonik Industries AG, Gattefossé, Ashland Global Holdings, Ingredion Incorporated, Unilever, Dow Chemical Company, Solvay S.A., AAK AB, and DuPont de Nemours. The market is segmented into Pharmaceuticals, Food and Beverages, Cosmetics and Personal Care, Nutraceuticals, Agriculture, Oil and Gas, Household Products, and Industrial Applications. The study employs a methodology combining desk research with qualitative primary research to predict market trends during the evaluation period 2026-2033. Geographically, the report examines consumption patterns, revenue generation, market share, and growth rates in North America (United States, Canada, Mexico), Europe (Germany, France, UK, Russia, Italy), Asia-Pacific (China, Japan, Korea, India, Southeast Asia), South America (Brazil, Argentina, Colombia), and the Middle East and Africa (Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt, Nigeria, South Africa). The report offers detailed insights on corporate strategy, SWOT analysis, key competitors, and future prospects, aiming to assist entrepreneurs, investors, and business strategists. The release was published on March 02, 2026, by openPR.com, authored by Ravina Pandya, a content writer for Coherent Market Insights Pvt. Ltd.

**Weekly Economic and Legal Calendar: Major Corporate Earnings, Climate Litigation, and EU Meetings Through March 13, 2026**
According to a report by dpa-AFX Wirtschaftsnachrichten GmbH published on March 02, 2026, a comprehensive schedule of economic and financial events is set for the week leading up to Friday, March 13, 2026. The schedule includes annual press conferences and financial results for major German corporations: Miele (Gütersloh), Raiffeisen Bank International (AUT), Schaeffler, Beiersdorf, DZ-Bank, Hettich Holding GmbH, Handelsverband Heimwerken, Bayer, Symrise, Adidas, Traton, LEG Immobilien, Ströer, DHL Group, and Lufthansa. International economic data releases include S&P Global PMI for the manufacturing sector for February 2026 from Japan, China, France, Poland, the Eurozone, the UK, and the USA, alongside the preliminary University of Michigan Consumer Confidence index for March 2026 in the USA. Legal proceedings scheduled include a Federal Court of Justice (Bundesgerichtshof) hearing regarding climate lawsuits filed by the German Environmental Aid (Deutsche Umwelthilfe) against BMW and Mercedes-Benz, which demand that these Dax companies cease selling conventional combustion engines by November 2030. Additionally, the Higher Regional Court (Oberlandesgericht) is set to hear a lawsuit by the Federal Association of Consumer Centres against Penny-Rabatt, alleging violations of the principle of equality by disadvantaging older customers who do not use the retailer's app. Political and industry events include the opening of the Chinese People's Congress in Beijing, informal meetings of EU ministers in Cyprus, the 3rd SZ Digital Summit in Munich, the International Tourism-Bourse (ITB) in Berlin running until March 5, 2026, and the 'Finanzplatztag 2026' featuring speakers such as Hessian Finance Minister Alexander Lorz (CDU) and Deutsche Bank CEO Christian Sewing.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 02, 2026 05:23 AM

Pinsent Masons, a law firm with specialists across Europe and Asia Pacific complemented by a global network of trusted partners, has been named the 'Litigation & Dispute Resolution Team of the Year' at the British Legal Awards 2022. Recognized by The Lawyer as 'litigation heavyweights' who 'regularly secure some of the biggest mandates to reach the English Courts', the firm employs experts who are 'most highly ranked in the legal directories'. These experts cover major areas of commercial dispute resolution, including breach of warranty claims, shareholder and joint venture (JV) disputes, earn-out disputes, minority shareholder actions, commercial contract disputes, securities litigation, and negligence claims. The firm advises on high-value and complex domestic and cross-border litigation and arbitration, as well as all forms of alternative dispute resolution. **Antoine Dupont to Headline Historic Rugby Clash and Adidas Campaign in March 2026**
According to Le10sport.com, French rugby star Antoine Dupont, who won a gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics in rugby sevens and plays for the French national XV team under coach Fabien Galthié, is central to a historic moment scheduled for March 14, 2026. The event will take place at the Stade de France in Saint-Denis, where France will face England in a 'Crunch' match. This game follows two closely contested previous encounters: a 25-26 loss for France in 2025 and a 33-31 victory for France in 2024. Additionally, the article notes that France suffered a defeat against England at Twickenham in February 2025 during the Six Nations tournament, which France ultimately won despite that loss. In light of Dupont's status as a 'standard-bearer' for French rugby and the significance of the upcoming match, Adidas is planning a historic advertisement blending the worlds of rugby and football.

**Essential Insurance Guide for Single Heads of Household in France**
According to an article published by Boursorama on March 01, 2026, managing a household alone requires specific insurance protections to prevent financial instability caused by unforeseen events. The article outlines mandatory insurance requirements in France: 'Assurance maladie' is the foundation for anyone living or working in the country; motor vehicle insurance is required for any motorized vehicle, even if parked; and 'assurance habitation' is mandatory for tenants and co-owners, covering civil liability, though it is not legally required for owners of individual houses despite the real risks. The text emphasizes that civil liability coverage is essential to avoid personal financial ruin from accidents like a child breaking an item or a pet causing damage, often included in home or auto policies, or via a private life civil liability contract if staying with relatives. For renters, the article notes that landlords can require proof of insurance annually and may insure the property at the tenant's expense if coverage is missing. For vehicle owners, minimum civil liability is mandatory to compensate third parties, while extended coverage depends on factors like mileage and vehicle value to prevent unaffordable expenses. While 'Assurance maladie' covers part of medical costs, the article states that 'complementary health' insurance is key for remaining costs, which are frequent for dental, glasses, and hospitalization; for private sector employees, company mutual insurance is generally mandatory. Additionally, 'assurance dommages-ouvrage' is legally required before major construction work to ensure rapid compensation for defects. The article also lists strategic optional insurances for single heads of household, including borrower's insurance, school activity insurance, and 'accidents de la vie' (life accidents) coverage, which protects against common incidents like falls or burns to prevent them from becoming financial catastrophes.
Original language: fr
Publish date: March 01, 2026 10:01 AM
Source:[Boursorama](https://www.boursorama.com/budget/actualites/prevoir-l-imprevu-les-assurances-indispensables-quand-on-est-seule-ou-cheffe-de-famille-84790040ff0df283be68f62272fb2158)

**Allianz SE Reduces Stock Holdings in DuPont de Nemours, Inc. $DD**
According to a Securities & Exchange Commission (SEC) disclosure, Allianz SE reduced its stake in DuPont de Nemours, Inc. (NYSE:DD) by 32.9% during the 3rd quarter, selling 11,774 shares to hold 24,058 shares valued at $1,874,000. While Allianz decreased its position, other institutional investors increased theirs: Blue Trust Inc. added 127 shares (1.1% increase), Pacifica Partners Inc. bought 128 shares (27.0% increase), Old Port Advisors purchased 147 shares (4.9% increase), Parcion Private Wealth LLC acquired 149 shares (0.5% increase), and Creative Financial Designs Inc. ADV bought 159 shares (36.1% increase in the 2nd quarter). Currently, 73.96% of DuPont de Nemours stock is owned by institutional investors. Regarding stock performance, shares opened at $50.05, with a 52-week range of $22.50 to $52.66, a market capitalization of $20.47 billion, and a price-to-earnings ratio of -26.91. On February 10th, the company reported Q4 earnings of $0.46 per share (EPS), beating the consensus estimate of $0.43, with revenue of $1.69 billion. DuPont de Nemours set FY 2026 EPS guidance at 2.250-2.300 and Q1 2026 guidance at 0.480. On November 6th, the board authorized a $2.00 billion stock buyback program, allowing the repurchase of up to 12.2% of shares. Additionally, the company declared a quarterly dividend of $0.20 per share, payable on March 16th to investors of record on March 2nd, representing a 1.6% yield. Analysts from Citigroup, Mizuho, Jefferies Financial Group, Wolfe Research, and UBS Group recently raised their price targets, ranging from $52.00 to $59.00, with MarketBeat reporting an average 'Moderate Buy' rating and an average price target of $51.86.

**AFP Sports Preview: New Football Rules, Global League Updates, and Motorsport Highlights**
The International Football Association Board (IFAB) announced new rules to combat time-wasting in football, including measures against feigning injuries and delaying kick-offs, which will take effect starting from the North America World Cup scheduled from June 11 to July 19, according to AFP. The sports preview covers multiple leagues: LaLiga's 26th round in Madrid, the Premier League's 28th round in London, the Bundesliga's 24th round in Berlin, Serie A's 27th round in Rome, and Ligue 1's 24th round in Paris, all with scheduled commentary times. In women's football, Colombia and Argentina are set to challenge the USA in the SheBelieves Cup in Los Angeles, with Colombia's star Linda Caicedo highlighted. Additional coverage includes matches in Buenos Aires, Mexico, and Miami for their respective leagues. In motorsports, Spanish driver Alex Palou aims to retain his title in the IndyCar Series, which begins in Miami, while in MotoGP, Spanish rider Pedro Acosta won the season-opening sprint in Buriram, Thailand, after defending champion Marc Márquez was demoted due to a penalty. The NBA regular season will also be covered in Los Angeles. This schedule was published by AFP on February 28, 2026, at 16:59 GMT.

**DuPont de Nemours, Inc. (DD) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript**
DuPont de Nemours, Inc. (DD) held its Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Earnings Conference Call on February 10, 2026, at 8:00 AM EST. The call was hosted by Ann Giancristoforo, Vice President of Investor Relations, Corporate FP&A, and Strategic Finance, alongside CEO Lori Koch and CFO Antonella Franzen. Presentations were available on DuPont’s Investor Relations website and via webcast, including a forward-looking disclaimer. --- Deep Research Analysis ---
Based on my search of news databases covering February-March 2026, here is the coverage of DuPont de Nemours regarding contracts, litigation, and management commentary in North America and Europe:

## Management Commentary and Financial Guidance

**February 10, 2026: 2026 Financial Targets and Portfolio Transformation**
CEO Lori Koch announced DuPont's guidance for 2026, targeting 3% organic sales growth and adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $2.25–$2.30 [18]. This represents increased confidence following a robust finish to 2025, during which the company achieved 2% full-year organic sales growth, 6% operating EBITDA growth, and 100 basis points of margin expansion [18].

Koch stated that margin expansion is expected to continue in 2026 with 60–80 basis points of improvement, driven by productivity gains, innovation, and favorable business mix—particularly in the Healthcare & Water Technologies segment. At least 20 basis points of this expansion is attributed to productivity improvements and ongoing cost discipline [18].

The management team addressed macroeconomic challenges facing the company, including flat automotive demand, weak construction activity, slow growth in China, and currency volatility. DuPont plans to counter these headwinds through segment innovation, cost control, and diversified business exposure, with expectations of stabilization across segments [18].

**February 11, 2026: Corporate Restructuring Update**
DuPont was cited among major corporations reversing corporate split strategies. The company abandoned its plan to spin off its water business in January 2025, though it proceeded with the separation of its electronics business [17]. This places DuPont within a broader trend of companies reassessing large-scale restructuring efforts amid strategic and financial pressures.

## Industry Market Position

DuPont de Nemours was consistently identified as a key market participant across multiple industrial sectors during February-March 2026, though these market research reports do not contain specific contract announcements:

- **Nanoemulsions Market**: Named as a major player in pharmaceuticals, food and beverages, cosmetics, and industrial applications [4]
- **Nanotechnology Services**: Identified as a notable player alongside Medtronic and AdvanceTEC LLC, with the market projected to reach $356.65 billion by 2030 [6]
- **Copolyester Market**: Listed among key players including Eastman Chemical, BASF, and SK Chemicals, with market growth projected from $4.79 billion (2026) to $7.25 billion (2033) [12]
- **Laminating Adhesives**: Named as a major player in flexible packaging applications across food, beverage, pharmaceutical, and electronics sectors [13]
- **Taste Masking Technologies**: Listed among prominent companies serving pharmaceutical and nutraceutical markets [14]
- **High Performance Polymers**: Identified as a market leader alongside BASF, Solvay, and SABIC, with particular focus on aerospace, automotive electrification, and healthcare applications [19]
